39355118.review:
Awesome. Just awesome.

This is the first visual novel I've played with voice acting. While it did take some getting used to, I do appreciate the effort that was put into voicing the characters in the story.
With Golden Hour, you get two prequels. Strings of Fate was great, I'd really like to see more Rin and Megumi storyline. The Lost Date was also quite good, with a good introduction into the main storyline of Eternal Hour.

After finishing the prequels, I'd have to admit I'm hooked on the story and anticipating more. I'm going to play the first chapter of Eternal Hour, which is also available for free. I can't wait for the full game to make it's way to my PC either. Seventh Heart Studios has another happy and eager follower.

39210674.review:
Золота година  - це цікава спроба створити коротку двосюжетну новелу в якій кожна частина , незалежить одна від одної . Головна героїня мила дівчина, котра в минулому байкер та анархіст , що намагається порвати із минули і знайти свій шлях по життю. В першій історії розповідається про знаходження коханої половинки з якою можна усамітнитись в темній печері. Тут автор тримає посмішку, адже типовий для лесбійської новели патерн сюжету - перетворюється на карикатурну зарисовку - що кращого місця для цілунків просто не змогли намалювати?
Інша історія - це пошук взаєморозуміння між троьма друзями які ще захворіли не сприйняттям свої почуттів, таких невиразливих персонажів я давно не бачив)))) Це ніби група скромних школярів , котрих запросили для участі в порнофільмі , але замість активних дій на камеру , вони завмерли на місці. Це реальна новела з якої вартує посміятися))))
Дорогий Сейкай проект будь-ласка якщо ти намагаєшься зробити безкоштовну новелу для аудиторії, просліди щоб над сюжетом попрацювали добре.....
Сюжет - 6/12 - банальна історія
Музика - 5/12 - щось грає , однак атмосфери не дає
Гемплей 6/12 - не заставляє тебе засинати, однак після неї хочеться випити пива і швидше забути
Емоційність 0/12 це те саме що побачити клоуна-алкоголіка і дати йому на проїзд в його рідний цирк((
Загальна оцінка - 6/12 Натягнута на загальну пустоту сюжету новела, котру не рятує ні безкоштовність, ні наявність хентай патчу ні наявність досягнень. Вона як пакет з супермаркету - використав і викинув на  смітник.....

Golden Hour is an interesting attempt to create a short two-story story in which each part is independent of each other. The main heroine is a pretty girl who was a past biker and anarchist trying to break from the past and find her way to life. In the first story tells about finding a loved one with whom you can be alone in a dark cave. Here the author keeps a smile, because the pattern of the plot typical for a lesbian story is turning into a caricature sketch - that the best place for kisses just could not draw?
Another story is the search for a mutual understanding between the three friends who were still ill with the perception of their feelings, I have not seen such an irresponsible character.)))) It's like a group of modest students who were invited to take part in a porno movie, but instead of active actions on the camera, they froze in place. This is a real story from which it is worth laughing))))
Dear Sayykay project please, if you try to make a free story for the audience, check that the plot worked well .....
Plot - 6/12 - a common tale
Music - 5/12 - It plays something, but it does not give the atmosphere
Gempley 6/12 - does not make you fall asleep, but after it wants to drink beer and forget about it sooner.
Emotionality 0/12 is the same as seeing a clown-alcoholic and letting him go to his native circus ((
Overall rating - 6/12 Stretched to the general void of the plot of the short story, which does not save either free of charge or the presence of hentai patch or the presence of achievements. She is like a package from a supermarket - used and thrown into a garbage dump .....

Золотой час - это интересная попытка создать короткую двосюжетну новеллу в которой каждая часть, не зависит друг от друга. Главная героиня милая девушка, которая в прошлом байкер и анархист, который пытается порвать с прошедших и найти свой путь по жизни. В первой истории рассказывается о нахождении любимой половинки которой можно уединиться в темной пещере. Здесь автор держит улыбку, ведь типичный для лесбийской новеллы паттерн сюжета - превращается в карикатурную зарисовку - что лучшего места для поцелуев просто не смогли нарисовать?
Другая история - это поиск взаимопонимания между троьма друзьями еще заболели неприятия свои чувств, таких невиразливих персонажей я давно не видел)))) Это как группа скромных школьников, которых пригласили для участия в порнофильме, но вместо активных действий на камеру, они замерли на месте. Это реальная новелла с которой стоит посмеяться))))
Дорогой Сейкай проект пожалуйста если ты намагаешься сделать бесплатную новеллу для аудитории, Проследи чтобы над сюжетом поработали хорошо .....
Сюжет - 6/12 - банальная история
Музыка - 5/12 - то играет, однако атмосферы не дает
Гемплей 6/12 - не заставляют тебя засыпать, однако после нее хочется выпить пива и быстрее забыть
Эмоциональность 0/12 это сродни увидеть клоуна-алкоголика и дать ему на проезд в его родной цирк ((
Общая оценка - 6/12 Натянутая на общую пустоту сюжета новелла, которую не спасает ни бесплатность, ни наличие хентай патча ни наличие достижений. Она как пакет из супермаркета - использовал и выбросил на помойку .....

38989328.review: Very charming visual novel. Really loved both the stories, so light-hearted and sweet. Both stories within are very well thought out and would highly recommend for others who like these type of game reads. Can't decide my favorite character, toss up between Megumi & Naoko. 38968944.review:
This is something of an appetizer for the full game they plan to release that will presumably elaborate further on the two stories started here. In this installment we are treated to a first glimpse at the budding loves of two newly formed couples and their strange connection to a little known cave down by the shore of the local lake. Both stories are quite short, yet decently satisfying while still leaving me looking forward to more. I've always been a sucker for sweet innocent romances and if you are too you will likely enjoy the story side of this well enough.

As to the other elements of the game - it has an enjoyable soundtrack and the art is decent enough. I'm not a big fan of the shading style on the characters, but their designs in general are otherwise fairly pleasing. The CGs have some slight animation to them, which is nice, though they may be a bit underwhelming otherwise.

My one complaint would be with the English voice acting. The sound quality is fine but the performances in generally are rather stiff and stilted. Honestly, I'd like it if they offered an option to switch between this and the orginal - I'm guessing Japanese based on the character names - which I would hope is a fair bit more natural than this dub.

Overall I'm glad I spent a few hours going through these stories and I look forward to the full game down the line.

I can't rly judge the game so far since the demo didn't get a lot of details on the plot, which makes it quite challenging. What will be the best is that the characters also share some japanese voices! 

Btw be careful while unlocking the hidden achievement since it will affect the ending of each prequel [spoiler]and release the mature content. If you only wanted to unlock the achievement without adding any changes to the ending, you must disable the h content in the game settings before you start a prequel. If you completely want to get rid of the mature content after getting the achievement, just make sure to remove the h-patch (not the music file) from the game files after you started the game with it in. From what i've tried i can tell it won't damage the game. [/spoiler]
Gl to the developers, i'd be glad to try out the full game

38638288.review: A cute little visual novel with easy-to-get achievements. Each story takes approx 30-60 minutes, depending on how fast you read. A good use of time for a free game. However, the voice acting is absolutely atrocious. Every line sounds so fake and forced. Even the regular conversation which should be so easy to say, as us humans talk like that almost every single day of our lives, sounds like two robots. I turned the voices off after a few minutes in Strings of Fate bleeding my ears. If you don't mind reading a visual novel without voices (which is how most are) then this is the game for you. The endings are sweet and there is also an 18+ patch out there for you pervs... Jk, I'm not judging. You need it to get the final achievement anyway. ;)

38544622.review:
Just +1, for playing the game longer I discovered that the writers use a more real life talk, in which the subject is outside the context. Furthermore there may be grammer errors. 

Chapter 1 (String of Fate):

0. For example "Good morning, Rin! Mind if I come in? ".
>> The subject you can be found within the context of the sentence. 

1. For example "Gone is the tiny cafe I used to frequent as a child, replaced now by a large restaurant."
>> The 'that' is not used or ',' so it create an different kind of flow.

2. For example:
 "I hope I can give something back to you, for all the time you supported me",
>> It could be possible that they didn't use correctly the present perfect (have supported) or using mixed times such as the past verb and present verb in one sentence.

3 For example: 
"But responsible... The idea never crossed my mind."
>> What does the writer mean with responsible? "being responsible to..." or" having responsiblity about.." or "being alive", I mean the sentence doesn't make any sense in the context.

4. For example: 
"They were on their way home the night they died."
>> Maybe it should use something to connect such as "that night" or "during that night", or "after that night".

5 For example: 
"I forget Tokya still has ancient structures like this"
>> Would maybe be "I forget that Tokya still has ancient structures like this", by adding 'that' in the sentence.

*If I am wrong just correct me please. I am not a perfect (native) English speaker and writer, however I have studied English as second language. 
It's just that I felt that the flow of the game at the introduction falters, and the things that I mention are the things I had noticed while playing the game. ~Bloooderhood

38533421.review: Görsel roman türündeki oyunlarla içli dışı değilim lâkin bu oyunu sevdim. Daha yeni başladım fakat keyifle ilerliyor; çizimler hoş, ilerleyiş sıkmıyor ve hikâye olarak da merak uyandırıcı yanları var. Kursa gidecek olmasaydım eğer birkaç saat oynar ondan sonra yazardım ama gitmeden önce bir iki kelâm edeyim istedim. İlerleyen vakitlerde düzenleme yaparak devam ederim.

38511961.review:
[h1]Warto na początku powiedzieć iż to nie jest pełna gra a jedynie prolog, który naprawdę wykonany jest świetnie i przynajmniej mnie zachęcił do oczekiwania na pełną wersje [b]Eternal Hour: Golden Hour ❤️[/b][/h1]

Gra ukazuje nam w krótkim czasie historię punk'owej cioci motocyklistki, która planuje w końcu zmieniń swoje życie na lepsze i zaopiekować się swoim bratankiem oraz drugą stronę medalu czyli historię owego bratanka, który wraz z przyjaciółmi postanawia wybrać się na plażę w pewne miejsce i zakosztować ciut dorosłych trunków ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

[b]Obie krótkie historyjki okraszone są oczywiście słodyczą, która wywołuje u mnie lekki [b]Cringe[/b], ale na pewno nie w złym znaczeniu tego słowa![/b]

Zdecydowanie najbardziej przypadła mi do gustu historia cioci Rin, gdyż sama postać była fajnie przedstawiona i mieliśmy okazje już utożsamić się z nią i przejść to świetnego miłego zakończenia a w przypadku Yasu, czyli bratanka Rin odczuwamy tylko chęć posiadania więcej kawałków historii, gdyż ta postać została bardzo słabo przedstawiona w prologu oraz historia była całkowicie w innym stylu niż poprzednia a zakończenie nie dawało już takiego częściowego spełnienia.

Twórcy tej gry zasługują również na pochwałę za dobrze dopasowaną muzykę oraz świetny dubbing, który jest naprawdę czyściutki i brzmi świetnie a wszystkie głosy męskie oraz damskie pasują do widzianych przez nas postaci jak [b]1:1![/b]

[h1][b]Eternal Hour: Golden Hour[/b] polecam bardzo serdecznie nawet mimo iż jest to dopiero prolog a pełna wersja jeszcze nie ujżała światła dziennego, gdyż gra już prezentuje się mistrzowsko i zdecydowanie czekam na więcej! 💚💙[/h1]

[h1]Plusy:[/h1]
[b]- Muzyka
- Świetny dubbing!
- Piękna kreska
- Przyjemne krótkie historyjki
[h1]Minusy:[/h1]
[b]- Narzekał bym na długość, ale opis wyraźnie wyjaśnia iż jest to "Prolog" :D

38502724.review:
Para empezar: Se nota muchisimo que no es una novela visual completa (y de hecho lo dice) sino que es un prólogo o una precuela para Eternal Hour, es decir, nos narra lo sucecido antes de lo que será el juego completo. Son dos historias cortitas en un solo juego, las dos bastante disfrutables.

Historias simples, nada rebuscadas pero muy bonitas, y si tienen algo de romance, así que si el género no les gusta, lo mismo descarten esto (aunque no se que Visual Novel no tiene romance), doblaje completo de voz (lo cual me pareció increible) y aunque por desgracia para los hispanohablantes no esta en español, no se necesita un nivel elevado de inglés para disfrutarlo. Ah y si, tiene parche +18. 

Vale mucho la pena echarle un ojo, a mi me atrapo para el juego completo, así que si te gustan las Visual Novel y no has visto esta, estas casi obligado. Es gratis además, así que no tienes excusa.

38394633.review: dammit, i'm hooked now and the full game is apparently only up on the creator's website. if/when it comes to steam, i'm jumping straight on this shit. the two parts in this game are prequels and they give you more background on characters than the actual plot, but that's not necessarily a complaint. it makes sense to keep it mostly hidden. 38391581.review:
This game is pretty, but it's not full and I don't think it's meant to be~

Eternal Hour: Golden Hour is a collection of prequels, built to deepen understanding in buildup for the full game, lovingly named "Eternal Hour." Storywise, it's not meant to do very much, only giving history for the characters and forshadowing the main plot point of the full game; a cave that does magical things.

Pros:
+ Voice acting: although not perfect, gets the job done (not many western visual novels get full voice dubs!)
+ Impressive art

Cons:
- Music is ok, but not very memorable
- Story is undeveloped

Final Words:
Pick up this game if you're planning to read the full novel later, or if you're fond of some good art (there's a naughty patch somewhere out there), but if you're looking for a full fledged story,look somewhere else

Then again, it's free

38387086.review:
Eternal Hour: Golden Hour is a free to play visual novel that contains two prequel stories to the paid visual novel, Eternal Hour.   I was disappointed with Strings of Fate due to the story escalating too quickly. There's not much backstory on either of the two characters and their motives. However, I was back to excitement after reading The Lost Date. 

What the Strings of Fate failed to present, The Lost Date fitted in by providing a great backstory and how the main character, Yasu, discover his hidden power. Nevertheless, it gets even better as Seventh Heart Studios also released the first chapter of Eternal Hour on their Kickstarter page. Many of the cliffhangers left by the prequel in The Lost Date are answered in the first chapter. 

My recommendations are to read the two prequels, starting with Strings of Fate, then to The Lost Date. From there, go to their Kickstarter page and download/read the free first chapter of Eternal Hour. If you're reading this review after the paid version of Eternal Hour is released, then buy it!

38362065.review:
Eternal Hour: Golden Hour does what it is supposed to ; being a prequel, introducing character and set up the story for the main game.

Overall it was a good quick ride, I enjoyed it.
It's really strong points are the art, which is gorgeous (I like the fact that the characters have multiple sprites), and the music (mist of time is so good).

As for the story, I would have enjoyed if it had put a little bit more time with Rin and Megumi, though the kiss really made up for that, it felt really romantic. The Lost added a lot of questions, and that's a good thing.

38272584.review:
This free to play romance visual novel by Seventh Heart Studios and Sekai Project features a two-part storyline in Strings of Fate and The Lost Date. In Strings of Fate, it features a female protagonist, Rin Fujimoto, who recently moved back to the small Japanese town of Tokya. Her main purpose in returning is to take care of her nephew, Yasu Fujimoto, after Rin's brother and sister-in-law passed away in a car accident. 

While at the orphanage to pick up Yasu, Rin is introduced to the chief volunteer at the orphanage, Megumi Shimizu. When Megumi comes to Rin's house to check on Yasu's progress, Megumi suggests going out together with Rin to shop for a cell phone and get to know each other better.

In The Lost Date, Yasu Fujimoto has grown up to become a teenager while living with his aunt Rin Fujimoto. His friends and classmates, Katashi and Tamiko, invite him to go to a cave by Kurokku Lake to partake in some alcohol illegally with Naoko and Daisuke, who are also both Climbers Club members.

Each short story will take approximately 30-60 minutes. I decided to give the game a score of 8/10 based on the following factors:

Plot and character backgrounds: The plot is written as a romance visual novel where depending on the responses Rin and Yasu give to Megumi and Naoko respectively, it can lead to the best ending with yuri and straight fan service. Alternatively, it may lead to a less desirable plot development and outcome where the relationship between the main characters doesn't evoke stronger feelings of love and passion for each other. The choices to reach the best endings are obvious and can easily be deduced. Some parts are censored in the Steam version, however a free uncensored patch is available at the developer's Google Drive through the Kickstarter page of its upcoming game [i]Eternal Hour[/i] as well as at Sekai Project's Denpasoft website. 

This is a short free to play game intended as a prequel to the longer game, [i]Eternal Hour[/i], which is currently still in development. The short length and simplistic character backgrounds, game play and story line, together with one plot hook on the supernatural sightings and occurences inside the cave make this visual novel good for those looking for a short experience to spend a couple of hours on. From that point, one can decide whether the story line and plot is interesting enough to commit to the longer visual novel [i]Eternal Hour[/i] when it is released in future.

Artwork: The artwork is colourful and attractive with an interactive menu interface where the featured characters will be enlarged when a short story is chosen. There are also animated CGs in the form of blinking eyes, waving hair, floating cherry blossom petals, passing fireflies and dust particles. I would have preferred to see more animated CGs for this game especially since the game description on Steam store page claims to feature animated CGs. There are actually 3 animated CGs, 2 animated H-CGs(not shown without uncensored patch) and 2 CGs with no animation. Hope to see more attractive animated CGs in [i]Eternal Hour[/i].

Voice acting and background music: The voice acting in English may seem out of place considering the game is featuring Japanese characters in a modern Japanese setting. Yet, for those who don't mind this, the voice acting is generally conveyed well with appropriate tones to match the different emotional moments in the game. Background music is also pleasant and appropriate to match the different moments in the game. My favourite BGM are Hearts Uniting at the title screen, Rin and Megumi getting intimate with each other(not shown without uncensored patch) and Yasu and Naoko being alone together in Yasu's room. Sakura Petals when Rin and Megumi start to have feelings for each other to indicate the beginning of their new relationship and Timeless when Rin wakes up to find herself elsewhere after passing out and Yasu and Naoko are alone together in the cave are also highlight tracks for me.

Overall, the game is recommended as a free-to-play visual novel for those who like a short romance tale with fan service and supernatural elements or for those who like a short game to finish and get all achievements in a few hours.

38232286.review:
A good friend recommended me about 8 free VN on steam that have approval rating 95% or above even though he knew I already have a very deep backlog. This is the third one I started. So far both Cinderella phenomenon and Doki-Doki Literature Club has been super amazing. So after the crushing experience I had with DDLC I decided to play another VN with even more cheerful cover page to release the burden off my mind. 

Guess what. The first scene of the first story involve a deep story of a girl who lost her loved ones in a car accident. Took a deep sigh I pressed on. This game was able to actually turn my mood around quite effectively with two short 1.5 hour normal reading speed VN into quite happy ending for both. 

Semi mediocre story Scripts, Lovable character models, relaxing sound, beautiful scenery pages, fully voiced conversation with decent voice acting joined together into enjoyable prequel VN that’s perfect for a quick mood swing. 

There is a nude patch on internet that require google drive to download. (If you from china use VPN) It will add just 2 extra scene to the story with just a little fan service teaser.) 

For Achievements it’s all pretty straight forward. I followed my heart and got both good ending with semi obvious story choice route. Last achievement require you to get that nude patch to unlock.  

8/10 and that’s 3 hours of enjoyable VN reading experience. Big thumbs up for being free and good luck completing the main game. Maybe I will buy it when it come out fully… Since some super natural content was hinted.

38192132.review:
My positive review is for Strings of Fate; I didn't enjoy The Lost Date that much.

+ Visuals: While the facial detail and backgrounds aren't particularly impressive outside of the animated scenes, there was a good amount of assets for the length and I hope that continues to be the case with the full game. The animated scenes could improve by following the narration more closely, but they are drawn and animated beautifully and I hope many more will come.

• Story: [spoiler]I enjoyed Strings of Fate, despite it feeling quite rushed. I know this is only a prequel, but it felt pretty awkward to lay out the heavy emotions after simply something along the lines of "we hung out every day for a month". More scenes and interactions between the two would've made the development of their relationship much more organic.

The Lost Date didn't feel rushed, but it was very cliché and seemed really silly to have characters collapse into sleep right as they're about to kiss or while they're having sex, and to make Yasu slower than a girl who had more to drink. Alcohol doesn't work like that and I wouldn't accept pinning everything on voodoo.[/spoiler]

• Audio: The music I heard was okay, but not memorable. The voiceover volume is somewhat inconsistent, and I was having trouble hearing Rin over the cooking.

• VA:
[list]
[*] Rin's audio seemed a bit muffled and a bit inconsistent in terms of volume. She pronounces Naoko like "Neiyoko" unlike the rest of the VAs.
[*] Megumi needs to keep working on her accent, and then hopefully her inflection will come more naturally.
[*] Yasu does not sound anything like a child. Thank goodness he only had a few seconds total.
[*] Hikaru didn't have enough lines for me to have an opinion.
[*] Can anyone tell me what accent Katashi is supposed to have? Even someone who's lived near Birmingham his whole life can't. It does make me want to punch him in the face more, so it works I guess.
[*] Tamiko is good.
[*] Naoko sounds to me like she's pinching her nose all the time. Guess I have different tastes.
[*] I think Daisuke needs a windscreen, but otherwise fine. His over-inflection suits his character.
[/list]

游戏分两个章节，左边 Eternal Hour: Strings of Fate Route，右边 Eternal Hour:The Lost Date.

左边章节 Eternal Hour: Strings of Fate Route 选择顺序：
START
Sorry, I thought someone else might step up.
I'm worried about Yasu. He still won't talk to me.
You are helping, Megumi.
I like something sweet once in awhile!
Maybe I should...
I believe you can do it if you put your mind to it!

获得成就名称：
Strings of Fate
Completed Eternal Hour: Strings of Fate
Fates Entwined
Got the best ending in Eternal Hour: Strings of Fate

右边章节 Eternal Hour: The Lost Date Route 选择顺序：
START
Yes, I am!
It won't be the same without you, Naoko!
Just having you there is all I could wish for.
Naoko and the Climbers Club.
Naoko doesn't act as immature as you do.
You look pretty sexy, Naoko.
Well, I guess we are on some kind of date.
If you really want to...

获得成就名称：
The Lost Date
Completed Eternal Hour: The Lost Date
Do You Remember...?
Got the best ending in Eternal Hour: The Lost Date
Golden Hour
Completed both Eternal Hour: Strings of Fate and Eternal Hour: The Lost Date

37993766.review:
Вечный час: Золотой час - занятный приквел к намечающейся визуальной новелле. К тому же быстрая "идеальная игра" в профиль.

[h1]Сюжет.[/h1]
В приквеле две сюжетных ветки - в одной рассказывается история девушки-панка по имени Рин, приехавшей в свой родной городок, дабы взять под опеку своего ставшего сиротой племянника. Ответственность за племянника и знакомство с куратором детского дома Мегуми изменит жизнь нашей героини. 
Вторая ветка происходит спустя n-е количество лет после первой, в ней мы узнаем историю Ясу, племянника Рин, и о том как его отдых с друзьями, приведет к череде странных событий. Обе ветки объединяет одна таинственная локация, и секреты с ней связанные, которые будут раскрыты в будущей новелле. Сюжет в приквеле больше про романтику, как обычную, так и "розовую".

[h1]Геймплей.[/h1]
Читаем текст делаем выборы. Развилок в игре мало. Как фича в игре есть возможность поставить хентай-патч. Если это сделать дадут достижение. Это мега ЛоЛ. ;) Сам патч и инструкция по установке здесь: [url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/737960919/eternal-hour-0/posts/2056489] How to apply the H-Patch! [/url]

[h1]Графика и звуки.[/h1]
Графика очень качественная, как задников так и персонажей, героини в CG сценах, выглядят прекрасно. Хуже всего как ни странно рисовка в хентай-сценах, их видимо делали для галочки. Музыка приятная, есть английская озвучка (японских героев, лол), озвучка довольно хорошая, только Ясу почему-то не озвучили.

[h1]Как итог.[/h1]
Приквел довольно хорош. Если сама новелла будет соответствовать заданному уровню, нас ждет увлекательная игра.
8 пещер из 10.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1126011506

[i]P.s: если этот обзор был для Вас полезен ставьте лайк, а также добавляйтесь в друзья и подписывайтесь на меня как куратора - [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28776273/] Обзоры онлайн [/url][/i]

37941269.review: This short,free visual novel prequel has surprised me with it's beautiful animated graphicsl,surprisingly good voice acting and likable characters,if a bit corny.

37938142.review:
This is a pretty good OEVLN.
The voice acting is on point and the visuals are actually good too.
(I've seen lots of OEVLNs with awfuls art styles, so this is a pleasant bonus)
The story is enjoyable for what it is and creates a level of intrigue.

However, it only lasts an hour or so.
Also the choices have no major impact, unless you are one for achievements.
I don't know how vital this will be to the story of Eternal Hour since it foreshadowed some time manipulating shenanigans, introduced a character that wasn't in the demo, and showed some rather short H-scenes.(Hit up 7th hearts twitter to get the patch)

Despite all this, I'd give this a thumbs up. 
For a kickstarter game, this was a nice bonus to have, and while a little underwhelming, it was a nice trip through.
It feels like a lot was missing and things happened really quickly, but that's to be expected in what is essentially Chapter 0/0.5 or prologue of Eternal Hour.
This along with the demo(which you can find on their kickstarter) should not be mistaken as the main dish, but they're worth a playthrough to find out if you'll enjoy Eternal Hour or to build up some hype.

tl;dr score
(Scoring based on MAL's standards, which are applicable to VNs oddly enough)
 
Story: 7/10 Some intriguing events and character development, but lacks detail in plot relevant areas

Art: 8/10 Good for a OEVLN, characters look appealing, backgrounds are okay and  the UI is neat

Sound: 7/10 Good atmospheric songs, none I'd add to my playlist, but gets the job done

Character: 8/10 Quality waifus, enough said

Enjoyment: 8/10 Short for my taste, good setup, didn't realize I'd enjoy a yuri story as much as I did and Naoko/Megumi are the GOAT.

Overall : 7.6/10, A worthwhile endeavor, a short joyride, a Golden Hour

37915703.review:
This kinda is my first serious review, so yea

This game is what it is, a prequel - and a good one at that, leaving you with the right cliffhanger so you would want to play the full history once it is out. 
The characters are yet to be truly discovered and thus I can't say much except for the obvious: 
> Dewds are awfully reckless (or what we would expect from teenagers, y'know)
> Do not eat an egg left on the sun for hours, it isn't a good idea

The art is pretty while somewhat simplistic, the artist is clearly still learning and thus, we could expect great things from the future.

The story? Like I said, this game do what its supposed to do right (being a prequel and all)

I give this a 7/10

(Edit: I reviewed my review and I noticed a little fuck up on the final score, so here I am, changing it. 

Explanation: 6,5 would be a reasonable score IF this was a full game on itself)

37915015.review:
[h1]Eternal Hour: Golden Hour[/h1]

Und wieder hat mich ein kostenloses Spiel in den Bann gezogen. Leider muss ich das "Spielen" auf Morgen verschieben, da es nun schon etwas später ist, aber ich habe nun ein wenig mir das Spiel angeschaut. Und hier kann ich auch bevor ich es durch habe schon bewerten. Wie bei allen VN´s werde ich nichts zur Story sagen, aber hier gibt man keinen Cent aus, also sollte man es sich selber anschauen.

Viele Dinge haben mich schon ab den ersten paar Minuten schon überzeugt ein Review zu schreiben. Bei kostenlosen Games schreibe ich sowieso normalerweise nichts negatives (bzw bewerte es nicht negativ). Kommen wir zu den Punkten die überzeugen oder stören könnten.

[b]Pro:[/b]
+ Erfolge
+ tolle Animationen und "Grafik"
+ Sound ist sehr gut
+ Sehr gut gedubbed
+ englischer Dub (alle Personen)
+ Story ist recht fesselnd
+ uncut Patch
+ free Game (+kostenlose Erweiterung außerhalb von Steam)

[b]Contra:[/b]
- Musik wirkt etwas fehl am Platz
- beim Auto Modus sollte man nicht auf vollen Anschlag stellen, da es dann wie Skippen ist (ich habe es dort auf 3/4 da ich relativ schnell lese)


[b]Fazit:[/b]
Zwar bin ich noch nicht weit, aber ich denke ich habe alles bis jetzt gesehen, um das Spiel bewerten zu können. Ich finde kostenlose Spiele sehr oft nicht interessant, aber Eternal Hour: Golden Hour hat mich sehr angesprochen. Nicht nur das es gut aussieht und das man merkt, dass hier jemand viel Liebe und Herzblut investiert hat, sondern auch eine recht packende Story. Zwar sind VN´s keine richtigen Spiele, aber auch keine Bücher oder Filme sondern etwas von allem, was man hier auch merkt. Durch Animationen sind bewegte Bilder sehr schön anzusehen und der Dub lässt einen auch zuhören und nicht nur lesen, wie bei vielen anderen VN´s.
Hier bereue ich es auf jeden Fall nicht, es mir angeschaut zu haben und es mir wahrscheinlich morgen, weiter zu "spielen". Ich kann nur jedem es empfehlen, wenn man auf dieses Genre steht. Also ein klarer Daumen nach Oben!


══════════════════════════════════════════════
[h1]Zensur in Games? Nein, danke![/h1]

Leider sind nicht alle Spiele, die auf Steam verfügbar sind und zensiert wurden, entsprechend gekennzeichnet. Wenn Du zuverlässige und stets aktuelle Informationen zum Zensurstatus von Spielen haben möchtest, schau doch mal bei [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/foruncut]for UNCUT![/url] vorbei und folge dem [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/1108903-for-UNCUT/]Kurator[/url], um über Zensuren in Spielen bescheid zu bekommen.

37912809.review:
[下の日本語から翻訳された]
These typically aren't my kind of games, however the voice acting was incredible and the animations were vivid. 
I couldn't help but enjoy leaving my mouse behind and listening to the characters talk on auto-play settings.

Downsides?
Overall the stories held some cliches, yet it didn't impact their appeal, nor was it the product of anything other than over-saturation of ideas in creative writing. 

You can tell plain as day that the story is still in motion (which might frustrate over-eager people who finish these stories in 20 minutes). Despite that, the feeling of incompletion helped drive home a promise from the developers: "We aren't done yet!"

Thank you Seventh Heart Studios for a well-crafted, well-translated, and progressive story tied into modern societal themes.

9.5/10 - Realistic, Thoughtful, & Fluid gameplay!

私は一般にストーリーベースのマンガゲームをしません。私の最初の不快感にもかかわらず、私はアニメーション、美しい対話、優れた文法を楽しんだ。私はあなたがこのゲームをするべきだと思います

37836762.review:
Seeing as how Eternal Hour: Golden Hour houses 2 separate prequels, I will have 2 separate reviews, it only seems fair to review each separately as opposed to a whole (with them being entirely different)

Upon completing my first playthrough Eternal Hour: Strings of Fate, I unlocked the Achievement for completing it. Thus, on my second playthrough I made sure to pick the right dialogues to get the 'Best Ending' Achievement.

I was very happy with Strings of Fate. The story was engaging and felt real. Getting to know how Rin feels about things made her feel like a real person could relate to her. It's a sweet love story between 2 young friends. Also the story sheds light on Yasu's character in a strong way, and it works very well in conveying emotion.

Overall I very much recommend this game to anyone that enjoys Visual Novels, as well as touching, heartfelt stories.

Visuals were very, stunning and beautiful.
The Soundtrack is calm, smooth and poetic in a way.
The Game was short-ish, but it's a prequel (and free) so there's no need to complain.
Yasu's Dialogue did seem a bit 'strange' if that makes sense, but it works; he's a nervous, young kid thrown into a whole new world.
The Rin's and Megumi's Dialogues were done well, and I enjoyed listening to them talk.

In the end, Eternal Hour: Strings of Fate gets a 9/10 from me.

Thank you for your hard work Seventh Heart Studios! And Congrats on making your project a reality!

____________________________________________________________

Ok, now for my review of Eternal Hour: The Lost Date. Same as SoF, I did 2 playthroughs. First one to get the ending, and the second to get the 'Best Ending' (thus giving me all 6 Achievements, thanks to the H-Patch)

Anyways, The Lost Date was very mysterious. The overall tone and atmosphere nailed it perfectly. The soundtrack helped drive the narrative home too. All of the characters were believable and I can relate to them personally. I can't say for sure if the game was shorter or longer than Strings, but the length felt good, it didn't drag, and I could not wait to see what was going to happen next!

It was very cute to see Yasu and Naoko and how they interacted and bonded, as friends. And how their relationship is strong and what it means to them. As well as how the understand their feelings for each other

I'm really looking forward to the the final release of the game. I'm going to play the demo again a few more times after having now experienced the backstory for all of the main characters. I'm also going to come back to Eternal Hour: Golden Hour for a few more playthroughs as well. (maybe without the H-Patch)

Finally the actual review from me is as follows

Visuals again, very stunning and beautiful (especially the characters)
The soundtrack kept me feeling intrigued and mystified
Short-ish length, but not a bad thing by any means
All the dialogues were very well done, (naoko being my favorite :p)

I give Eternal Hour: The Lost Date 9.5/10

Again, Seventh Heart Studios, Thank you! And good luck in your future!
